title: Benefits of Mongol conquests for Silk Road trade

content.question: The Mongol conquests of much of Eurasia in the thirteenth century tended to encourage trade along the Silk Roads primarily by

choices.label: opening large new markets for both European and East Asian goods in Central Asia
increasing the demand for military supplies needed by the Mongol armies that occupied various regions
decreasing the risk of bandit attacks and reducing the number of local rulers collecting tribute from trade caravans
discouraging seaborne trade along the Indian Ocean routes that competed with the Silk Roads

content.answer: decreasing the risk of bandit attacks and reducing the number of local rulers collecting tribute from trade caravans
